Open: 234.5 | -310 | +250 | Line movement shows spread tightening from Portland -7.5 open to -8.5/-9 current, and total rising from 234.5 to 235.5, indicating sharper action on Portland cover and higher-scoring game.[2] ### Team Records and ATS Trends - **Portland Trail Blazers**: 24-28 overall; 12-13 ATS on road; 1-4 straight up and ATS in last 5 games; 66.7% win rate (12-6) as favorites; covered spread 1/4 times favored by 8.5+; 27-25 O/U overall, overs in 4/5 last games and 16/27 home games.[1][2] - **Memphis Grizzlies**: 20-30 overall; 4-6 ATS and 3-7 SU in last 10; 21-29 ATS overall (10-13-1 road); 27.3% win rate (9-24) as underdogs; covered 2/10 as 8.5+ underdogs; 23-27 O/U overall (37.5% overs away).[1][2] Portland has covered 56% at home (15-12), while Memphis is 33% on road (8-16); teams split last 2 meetings 1-1 ATS.[1][3] ### Recent Performance Context - Grizzlies average 115.3 PPG (2.8 below Portland's 118.1 allowed); 11-8 ATS when scoring >118.1; shoot 45.7% FG (below Portland opponents' 47.3%); better ATS on road as underdogs but worse O/U away.[1] - Trail Blazers average 115.6 PPG (1.8 below Memphis' 117.4 allowed); opponents' combined scoring averages 3 points above 232.5 total; 26/50 games hit over.[1] Last 10 Grizzlies games averaged 232.6 total (0.1 above current line).[1] Portland 1-4 SU/ATS last 5 impacts favorite status reliability.[2] ### Injury and News Status No specific pre-game injury confirmations or player status updates available in results; player prop projections listed (e.g., Deni Avdija 25.21 pts, Jerami Grant 18.93 pts, Ty Jerome 15.47 pts, Cedric Coward 14.06 pts) imply expected participation.[4] ### Head-to-Head and Advanced Stats Teams 1-1 ATS in last 2 meetings; Portland holds rebounding edge (50.3-37.5 projected), Grizzlies lower turnovers (14.2 vs 15.3).[3] AccuScore gives Portland 72.1% win probability; shooting projections: Grizzlies 47.0% FG, Portland 48.2%.[3]
